column4: Hi, any of the developers working on the faster boot process around?
Are you using the default "boot-chart", or have you modified it?
I have talked to them about it
Interesting
my top here by default doesn't include the "PPID" column, which boot-chart tries to use.
I can look for a sec though
i tried building it with gcj but failed. Building it for sun jdk worked.
which number are you looking for? the numbers reported in top are treacheous.
the VM size usually inkludes like 4M unused memory for each thread IIRC.
so, what's accurate?
no idea. the RSS value should be much better.
see that's not in top for me
RES in top i think.
i think using "RES - SHR" could be a fair value.
really?
can you set pins in synaptic?
no idea.
actually, it has a "set internal variable'  I think that may be it
i'm a debian user, and while i know the synaptic author closely - we worked together on integrating debtags with synaptic - i don't use synaptic myself. guis are always way to slow.
you can probably set the "default distribution" with that, but not arbitrary pins
It's nice to search for packages, but I do use apt-get quite a bit too
more for browsing that for searching actually. For mere searching i prefer "apt-cache search"
actually, on debian, I always use packages.debian.org
